it surprising that Washington Examiner writer Mike Pence Barone would contend "old rules don't apply to" the 2012 Republican primary election campaign even though every Republican presidential nominee since Ronald Reagan in 1980 has been pro-life. The next rule that needs to be debunked is that Republican candidates must pass a litmus test on cultural issues, especially abortion. This was true in 1988, 1996 and 2000, when religious conservatives were a newly energized political force and one stirred to action by Bill Clinton 's misconduct, he writes. regrets of another domineering defense secretary-- the late Robert McNamara -- who came to describe the Vietnam War as "terribly wrong." "That's not the case with Iraq," Donald Rumsfeld countered.
